guidelines.title: Code Style
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's coding standards and style guide. This ensures that the codebase remains consistent and maintainable. Developers should format their code properly and follow any specific syntax rules outlined by the project.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Write and run tests for any new features or bug fixes. This helps to ensure the stability of the project and prevents new changes from introducing errors. Including tests in the contribution provides confidence in the quality and functionality of the code.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Update the documentation to reflect any changes made. This ensures that users and other developers understand how to use the new features or changes. Clear, thorough documentation is essential for the project's usability and ongoing development.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Submit pull requests for any contributions. This allows the project maintainers to review the changes before they are merged into the main branch. Pull requests should follow the specified format and include a clear description of the changes and purpose.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Report issues using the project's issue tracker. When reporting an issue, provide a detailed description, including steps to reproduce, expected behavior, and screenshots if applicable. This helps maintainers identify and address problems effectively.

guidelines.title: Review Feedback
guidelines.description: Respond to feedback from code reviews in a timely manner. Collaboration and communication are key to the contribution process. Address any requested changes and engage in discussions to improve the overall quality of the project.

guidelines.title: Branching Strategy
guidelines.description: Follow the project's branching strategy. Typically, this involves creating a feature branch from the main branch for your changes and submitting the pull request from that branch. This helps in managing the code changes in an organized way and reduces conflicts.
